H0.text: Nitrogen is used in respiration to generate energy, which is the main reason humans need nitrogen to survive.

H1.text: Nitrogen is used in making the proteins in the body, which is the main reason humans need nitrogen to survive.

H2.text: Nitrogen is used to help the body eliminate wastes, which is the main reason humans need nitrogen to survive.

H3.text: Nitrogen is used by nerve cells to conduct impulses, which is the main reason humans need nitrogen to survive.

A4.text: Nitrogen is an essential component of nucleic acids, amino acids and thus proteins, and is thus vital to all life on Earth.

A5.text: Animal metabolism of nitrogen in proteins, in general, results in the excretion of urea, while animal metabolism of nucleic acids results in the excretion of urea and uric acid.

A6.text: The other product of transamidation is a keto acid that enters the citric acid cycle.

A7.text: The total nitrogen content of organic matter is mainly formed by the amino groups in proteins.
